comments:
Created an attachment (id=82938)
Eclipse .log file

Build ID: M20071023-1652

Steps To Reproduce:
1. Set breakpoint in Google's Hello, Android demo app.
2. Run > Debug app
3. Eclipse's "Internal Errror" dialog pops up and recommends I close the workbench.

More information:
I've installed the Android plugin and am going through the Hello, Android example: http://code.google.com/android/intro/hello-android.html

I set the breakpoint and try to debug the app, but I get an Internal Error dialog that recommends I shut down the workbench.

Looking at the .log, I see a series of four exceptions, in this order:

1. !ENTRY org.eclipse.ui.console 4 2 2007-11-15 04:33:19.370
!MESSAGE Problems occurred when invoking code from plug-in: "org.eclipse.ui.console".
!STACK 0
org.eclipse.swt.SWTException: Invalid thread access
        at org.eclipse.swt.SWT.error(SWT.java:3563)

2. !ENTRY org.eclipse.ui.console 4 120 2007-11-15 04:33:19.383
!MESSAGE Exception occurred during console property change notification.
!STACK 0
org.eclipse.swt.SWTException: Invalid thread access
        at org.eclipse.swt.SWT.error(SWT.java:3563)

3. !ENTRY org.eclipse.core.jobs 4 2 2007-11-15 04:34:04.813
!MESSAGE An internal error occurred during: "has children update".
!STACK 0
java.lang.InternalError: Invalid signature: "<null>"
        at org.eclipse.jdi.internal.TypeImpl.signatureToTag(TypeImpl.java:307)

4. !ENTRY org.eclipse.core.jobs 4 2 2007-11-15 04:34:05.595
!MESSAGE An internal error occurred during: "Label Job".
!STACK 0
java.lang.InternalError: Invalid signature: "<null>"
        at org.eclipse.jdi.internal.TypeImpl.signatureToTag(TypeImpl.java:307)

I'll attach tje complete log file, and a screen shot of eclipse (if it's not too large).

This is on Ubuntu 7.10 (Gutsy Gibbon), by the way.

Created an attachment (id=82939)
Screenshot of Eclipse at point where Internal Error occurs
I'm not sure if this is a JDT problem. The error log shows that it is Google's code that is doing the SWT calls.
I'll raise this issue on the Android Developers Google Group and see what they think.  Thanks.

Invalid thread access is coming from:

com.google.android.adt.AndroidPlugin.start(AndroidPlugin.java:216)

A launch can occur in a non-UI thread. Clients have to allow for this.
